page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Lower Nazeing Our area that surrounds Lower Nazeing is predominantly agricultural, mainly of the type of farming known as Market Gardening, that is growing crops such as salad crops like tomatoes, lettuce as well as producing flowers. Running through the area that we covered is part of the Lea (or Lee) Valley Park which is a recreational area used for activities such as fishing, sailing as well as walking. Much of the countryside is of a rolling nature more typical of the South Downs in Southern England. The gravel workings, some of which are no longer used, are integrated into the Lee Valley Park. Lower Nazeing is some eight miles from the town of Harlow, which is found to the east, and some four miles from Hoddesdon.
